bill_title: authorize the submission of an application for a state innovation waiver regarding health insurance and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the submission of an application for a state innovation waiver regarding health insurance and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 58-17 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: The director of the Division of Insurance may apply to the United States secretary of health and human services and the United States secretary of the treasury for a state innovation waiver regarding health insurance coverage in this state as authorized by section 1332 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, 42 U.S.C. 18052 as of January 1, 2017. The application shall include provisions for a market that provides access to affordable health insurance coverage for the residents of this state. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.161 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
